meta.title: Implement OAuth2 integration for Google and GitHub

task.role: You are a Senior Security Engineer with expertise in authentication and secure coding. Implement Task 19 with production-quality code.

context.overview: Add OAuth2 authentication flow supporting Google and GitHub providers with callback handling and user profile synchronization.
context.background: Review PRD and architecture in .tasks/docs/ for full context.

requirements.description: 1. Add dependency: oauth2 = "4.4" 2. Create domain/oauth.rs with: - OAuthProvider enum (Google, GitHub) - OAuthClient struct wrapping oauth2::BasicClient 3. Implement OAuth flow in api/oauth.rs: - GET /api/auth/oauth/{provider} -> redirect to provider with state parameter - GET /api/auth/oauth/{provider}/callback -> exchange code for token, fetch user profile 4. Store OAuth state in Redis with 10min TTL for CSRF protection 5. Create or update user in database: - If oauth_provider + oauth_id exists, login - Else create new user with email from profile 6. Return TokenPair after successful OAuth 7. Add to config: GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, GITHUB_CLIENT_ID, GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET, OAUTH_REDIRECT_URL 8. Handle provider-specific profile APIs: - Google: https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v2/userinfo - GitHub: https://api.github.com/user

constraints.constraint: PR title: feat(task-19): Implement OAuth2 integration for Google and GitHub

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Manual testing with real OAuth providers in development. Mock OAuth responses for integration tests. Verify state validation prevents CSRF. Test user creation and login flows. Verify email conflicts handled gracefully.
